channel.title: Mend.io Unified Release Notes
channel.description: Aggregated RSS, Atom, and HTML of all Mend release notes.

item.title: Mend for Bitbucket DC: Version 25.6.1.3 (01-July-2025)
item.description:
Resolved Issues

  • Updated the org.eclipse.jgit dependency in the scanner and controller to version 6.10.1.202505221210-r to fix CVE-2025-4949.

item.title: Mend for GitLab: Version 25.6.1.3 (01-July-2025)
item.description:
Resolved Issues

  • Updated the org.eclipse.jgit dependency in the scanner and controller to version 6.10.1.202505221210-r to fix CVE-2025-4949.

item.title: Mend for GitHub Enterprise: Version 25.6.1.3 (01-July-2025)
item.description:
Resolved Issues

  • Updated the org.eclipse.jgit dependency in the scanner and controller to version 6.10.1.202505221210-r to fix CVE-2025-4949.

item.title: Mend for GitHub.com: Version 25.6.1 (29-June-2025)
item.description:
Unified Agent 25.4.3-179 | Renovate 40.62.1 | Remediate 25.6.1 | Pre-Scan Builder (PSB) 25.4.1

New Features and Updates

  • Mend AI is now available in all the repository integrations!

    • The Mend AI detection is performed automatically as part of your SCA scan.

    • Mend AI results are only available in the Mend AppSec Platform UI.

  • Upgraded the Node version in the scanner from 20.12.0 to 22.11.0.

  • (SAST) Introduced the capability to scan both source code and configuration files for exposed credentials. This feature can be enabled using the enableSecretsScan parameter.

item.title: Mend Developer Platform: Version 25.6.2 (13-July-2025)
item.description:
New Features and Updates

  • The Developer Platform now enables users to add a user name alongside tokens when setting up host rules. This is not mandatory, but needed for some specific registries.

Resolved Issues

  • Fixed a bug where existing secrets were not displayed under Credentials -> Host Rules in the Settings menu.

item.title: Mend CLI: Version 25.6.1.1 (10-July-2025)
item.description:
Resolved Issues

  • (SCA) Hotfix: Fixed an issue where the CLI would incorrectly report an invalid organization token, leading to scan failure.

item.title: Mend AI: Version 25.6.2 (13-July-2025)
item.description:
New Features and Updates

  • AI-Powered Model Extraction is now available!

    Mend AI now includes an upgraded detection engine, identifying 10x more models than the previous, pattern-based approach. This is a major leap forward in visibility and coverage.

    To activate it:

    1. Go to Administration > AI Configuration.

    2. Create a new config or edit an existing one.

    3. Toggle AI-Powered Code Snippet Analysis on.

    4. Set it as the default to apply organization-wide.

  • The APIs for retrieving AI technologies and AI models are now available under Findings - Project.

    • Get project AI technologies (AI): Returns a list of AI technologies used in a specific project.

    • Get project AI models (AI): Returns a list of AI models used in a specific project.

  • AI model detection has been expanded to include additional artifact types and sizes.

item.title: Mend Container: Version 25.6.2 (13-July-2025)
item.description:
New Features and Updates

  • Updated the UI for defining Kubernetes integrations that closely mimics the Registry integrations flow.

    • Added a Configuration step where users can define a schedule for automatically triggering a scan on the Kubernetes integration.

    • Additionally, the last scan time for Kubernetes integrations is now shown in the the My Integrations table.

item.title: Mend SAST: Version 25.6.2 (14-July-2025)
item.description:
New Features and Updates

  • The workflow engine now allows users to use compliance standard violations directly as conditions, without needing to configure CWEs manually.

  • Introduced handling of historical findings older than 90 days. This ensures that previously suppressed findings will not reappear as new issues.

  • Introduced a detailed progress indicator for the code analysis in the CLI, giving users better visibility into scan progress.

  • Findings reports now include Violations, "Endpoint Access", and "Exploitable" data columns, enabling AppSec managers to efficiently assess and prioritize risks.

Resolved Issues

  • Fixed an issue where multi-line statements with a lambda function showed the wrong line number, pointing to the start of the entire statement instead of the lambda. Now, the line number shows exactly where the lambda is, so its easier to find and fix.

  • Fixed an issue where temporary variable names in the trace caused findings to mismatch with previous scans. This sometimes led to previously suppressed findings being incorrectly reported again.

item.title: Mend SCA: Version 25.6.1 (29-June-2025)
item.description:
New Features and Updates

  • The Findings report now highlights fixable issues via HeroDevs in the form of a corresponding Fix Type value in the Excel-format export.

item.title: Mend AppSec Platform: Version 25.6.2.1 (15-July-2025)
item.description:
New Features and Updates

  • A new configuration page for email notifications is now available, allowing previous distribution list email notification receivers to disable Scan Summary Email notifications.

    • Email notification receivers can enable/disable Scan Summary Email notifications via My Profile Email Notifications.

    • Email notifications can be enabled/disabled per organization or for all organizations in bulk.
